Package entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
entities.Entity
entities.Player
public class Player extends Entity
This player class will hold every variable and funciton relating to the active player's inputs and outputs.
Author:
John Botonakis and Sean-Paul Brown

  • Field Details

    • MAX_JUMPS

      public static final int MAX_JUMPS
      this is the maximum number of jumps that can occur mid-air. Setting this to 2 means that there is a 'double jump' mechanic.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • playing

      private final Playing playing
      This is the Playing class that the Player is currently in

    • animations

      private BufferedImage[][] animations
      This all of the animations that the player will do. The first index maps to the PlayerConstants actions, and the second index is the a specifc frame

    • levelData

      private int[][] levelData
      The current Level's level data, represented as a 2D int array

    • player_action

      private int player_action
      The state/action the player is int

      A boolean indicating whether the player is currently moving.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(float x, float y, int width, int height, Playing playing)
      Constructor for the player class
      Parameters:
      x - - X-Position on the screen
      y - - Y-Position on the screen
      width - - Width of Sprite
      height - - Height of Sprite
      playing - - the Playing GameState

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(int xLevelOffset)
      Handles updates for Position, Animation Tick, and Setting Animations
      Parameters:
      xLevelOffset - - how far the screen offset is from scrolling

    • renderPlayer

      public void renderPlayer(Graphics g)
      Renders the player, along with hitbox
      Parameters:
      g - - Graphics where to draw the player

    • loadAni

      private void loadAni()
      Creates an animation library to store every animation from the loaded in sprite sheet

    • loadLvlData

      public void loadLvlData(int[][] lvlData)
      Load in level data as a 2D array to continuously check for collision
      Parameters:
      lvlData - - The data that

    • updateAniTick

      private void updateAniTick()
      Increments an animation index to simulate fluid movement by drawing the next image in the sprite sheet

    • updatePos

      private void updatePos()
      This is a multi-faceted function, allowing the position of the player to be updated whenever an input is passed through. Standard key inputs are A,D, and Spacebar controlling left, right, and jump movement respectively. Further in, this funciton also calculates what happens when coming down from a jump, falling off a ledge, or any other movement.

    • worldBoundsCheck

      private void worldBoundsCheck()
      This is a helper method that checks if the player has gone past the Game's Height. If the player has, then they are killed.

    • faceRight

      private void faceRight()
      This is a helper function to "flip" the sprite so that it is facing towards the right side of the screen.

    • faceLeft

      private void faceLeft()
      This is a helper function to "flip" the sprite so that it is facing towards the left side of the screen.

    • jump

      private void jump()
      Handles event where the jump button, Space bar, is pressed

    • dash

      private void dash()
      Handles event where the dash button (Shift) is pressed

    • shoot

      public void shoot(Point p)
      This will start the Player attacking. If this is called then
      Parameters:
      p - - the Point where the next attack would be heading

    • checkAttack

      private void checkAttack()
      Check if the Players attack. If the attack has already been checked, don't check it

    • resetInAir

      private void resetInAir()
      Reset the variables that determine ability to jump

    • updateXPos

      private void updateXPos(float xSpeed)
      Updates X-Position of player after hitbox detects collision
      Parameters:
      xSpeed - - how fast the player is moving

    • setAnimation

      private void setAnimation()
      Sets the animation based on how Player is moving and what state the Player is in

    • resetAniTick

      private void resetAniTick()
      Resets animation to ensure that the animation is rendered timely

    • resetDirBools

      public void resetDirBools()
      Resets player inputs in event window looses focus

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Mainly for testing, this function assigns a "kill" state if the player's health is too low, OR kill was evoked via key binds

      Returns:

    • setNextAttack

      public void setNextAttack(Point p)
      Setter for the nextAttack Point and will switch where the player is facing based on where the mouse is
      Parameters:
      p - the Point where the next attack will be located

    • setDrawArrowPath

      public void setDrawArrowPath(boolean drawArrowPath)
      Setter for drawArrowPath. If this is true, then a line will be drawn from the Player to nextAttack Point
      Parameters:
      drawArrowPath - - true to draw the line, false to not

    • hurt

      public void hurt()
      This method will give 1 damage to the player and check if they have died.

    • heal

      public void heal()
      This method gives 1 health point back to the player and makes sure they only have the maximum amount of health.

      the current level data array

    • getState

      public int getState()
      This classes uses player_action instead of "state" because it is slightly more descriptive. Functionality is the same as Entity's getState.
      Overrides:
      getState in class Entity
      Returns:
      the state that the entity is in

    • getMaxJumps

      public static int getMaxJumps()
      Getter for the maximum number of jumps the Player can have
      Returns:
      the constant maximum number of jumps

    • isAttacking

      public boolean isAttacking()
      Getter for the current value of attacking
      Returns:
      return the value currently stored

    • getFlipX

      public int getFlipX()
      Getter for the current value of flipX
      Returns:
      If facing right, this should be 0. If left, it will be the width

    • getFlipW

      public int getFlipW()
      Getter for the current value of flipW
      Returns:
      If facing right, this should be 1. If left, it will be -1

    • getNextAttack

      public Point getNextAttack()
      Getter for the stored Point for the next attack
      Returns:
      return the Point that was placed into the shoot() or setNextAttack() functions.
